chapter.title: &Yap; Tools
chapter.para: &Yap; provides several tools for browsing the &DVI; document.

section.title: Browsing Source Specials
section.para:
The command
Tools Source Specials...
opens the the Source Specials window.

section.title: Source Specials Window
section.para: This window lists all source specials found in the current &DVI; document.
The Goto button brings into view the portion of the &DVI; document which contains the selected source special.
The Edit Source button invokes an editor to edit the TeX source corresponding to the selected source special.

section.title: Ruler
section.para:
The ruler tool allows you to measure distances on a page. You select the ruler tool with the command
Tools Ruler
or by clicking the corresponding button on the toolbar.
Pressing the left mouse button activates the horizontal ruler. Pressing the left mouse button in combination with the Shift key activates the vertical ruler.
You can change the measurement unit (see ).

section.title: Hand Tool
section.para:
The hand tool allows you to scroll the page by moving the cursor while the left mouse button is pressed. You select the hand Tool with the command
Tools Hand Tool
or by clicking the corresponding button in the toolbar.

section.title: Magnifying Glass
section.para:
The magnifying glass allows you to view a small part of the unshrunk page. You select this tool with the command
Tools Magnifying Glass
or by clicking the corresponding button in the toolbar.
You can choose between three sizes:

listitem.para: Pressing the left mouse button activates the small magnifying glass.
Pressing the left mouse button in combination with the Shift key activates the medium sized magnifying glass.
Pressing the left mouse button in combination with the Control key activates the large magnifying glass.

section.para: You can customize the appearance of the magnifying glass (see ).

You can specify the power of the magnifying glass by entering a numerical prefix argument. The argument is interpreted as a shrink factor for the text inside the magnifying glass. A shrink factor of 1 (the default) results in a maximum magnification.
